intro: Pseuduvaria luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon pseuduvaria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in humid, shaded environments. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
